summary: The President and Vice President of the United States are legally allowed to spend funds for certain specified purposes—e.g., official travel, residential maintenance, entertainment—and account for them solely with "official certificates." Spending that's authorized this way is known as certificated expenditures. We examined these certificated expenditures for fiscal year 2022 and determined that they were spent for the purposes authorized under the relevant law.
title: White House Spending: FY 2022 Certificated Expenditures of the President and Vice President Were for Authorized Purposes
topics: Consolidated Financial Statements of the U.S. Government
